Climate House® Bremerhaven 8° East

Historical Museum Bremerhaven

© Laurence Delderfield
• Tourism • Museums & Adventure Worlds
  • Recommend page
  • Listen

Climate House® Bremerhaven 8° East

Climate journey around the world. Be amazed, sweat and freeze in the Klimahaus Bremerhaven 8° Ost.

Take a trip round the world and experience the world’s climate zones: From the refreshing coolness on the alp in Switzerland, through the scorching heat of the Sahel to the iciness of the Antarctic as well as the heavenly climate of the South Seas and the unsettled weather in Northern Germany. On the “Journey” in the Klimahaus Bremerhaven 8° Ost visitors can experience first hand how the people live in the Earth’s most important climate zones. The tour along the eighth degree of longitude East leads through sceneries that are built true to original locations.

Impressions

The “Perspectives” is another major section of the exhibition, which takes a look at past and present climates, and the impacts on the future. In the section “Opportunities” the visitor is shown choices of action: he can, for example, test hands-on in theme chambers how he can contribute personally in everyday life to the reduction in CO2 emissions.

Opening hours

Opening hours

from 1st April to 31st August
- from Monday to Friday 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.
- Saturday/Sunday/official holiday 10 a.m. to 7 p.m.

from 1st September to 31st March
- from Monday to Friday 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.
- Saturday/Sunday/official holiday 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.
Closed 24th, 25th and 31st December and 1st January

Length of stay

120 minutes minimum length of stay
180 minutes on average length of stay
240 minutes recommended length of stay

Notice

Last entrance 90 minutes before closing!

Tickets and admission fees

Entrance fees 2017

- Adults € 16,00
- Children till 5 years free of charge
- Reduced* € 11,50
- Family-Card (2 Adults + 2 children up to 18 years) € 48,00
- "Small" Family-Card (1 Adult + 2 children up to 18 years) € 35,00
- Group of adults (from 15 person) € 13,00
- Group of reduced* (from 15 person) € 8,50

Annual ticket fees:
- Adults € 54,00
- Reduced* € 37,00
- Family € 110,00

*Children up to 5 years/Pupils/Students/Federal voluntary community service/ People with handicapped (up to 70 %)
